snippet: Yankees first baseman Mark Teixeira said the most recent news about the link between Alex Rodriguez and a Miami clinic is “very disappointing.”
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that if baseball can prove New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez did, indeed, have another dalliance with banned substances, he may no longer have much support in the clubhouse; notes that landscape of game has changed, and revelation by ESPN that more than 20 players could face 100-game suspensions is another, deeper, stain on profession.
lead_paragraph: Yankees first baseman Mark Teixeira said the most recent news about the link between Alex Rodriguez and a Miami clinic is “very disappointing.”

headline.seo: The Specter of Rodriguez Pierces Yankees’ Clubhouse
headline.main: The Sizable Shadow That Won’t Leave the Yankees
headline.print_headline: A Sizable Shadow That Won’t Leave the Yankees
